page.title: 04Stratton School Farm.
page.content: Stratton School farm was built in the 1950's and agricultural science was and still is taught. The farm was originally five acres in size, today it is ten acres and is located at the rear of the school. The farm keeps pigs, cattle chickens and turkeys. A new barn has been built for the pigs.Wheat, barley, grass, brussel sprouts, carrots, potatoes and beetroot are grown.There are orchards and greenhouses on the farm. There are five tractors on the farm, three of these are vintage tractors. Most of the other machinery used on the farm is hired. The farm runs on an allowance from the county council. Products from the farm are sold to the public. A conservation area for biology is planned.
